quiz.question: What is JavaScript??
options: A programming language
A database management system
A markup language
An operating system
quiz.answer: A programming language

quiz.question: What is the purpose of the 'typeof' operator in JavaScript?
options: To create a new variable
To concatenate strings
To define a function
To check the data type of a variable
quiz.answer: To check the data type of a variable

quiz.question: What is the purpose of the return statement in a function?
options: To print a value to the console
To exit the function and return a value
To declare a variable
To concatenate strings
quiz.answer: To exit the function and return a value

quiz.question: What is the difference between null and undefined in JavaScript?
options: They are the same
null represents the absence of a value, while undefined is a variable that has been declared but not assigned a value
undefined represents the absence of a value, while null is a variable that has been declared but not assigned a value
null and undefined are both used to represent an empty string
quiz.answer: null represents the absence of a value, while undefined is a variable that has been declared but not assigned a value

quiz.question: Which keyword is used to prevent a variable from being modified?
options: freeze
const
lock
protect
quiz.answer: const

quiz.question: What is the purpose of the querySelectorAll method in JavaScript?
options: Selects the first element that matches a specified CSS selector
Selects all elements that match a specified CSS selector
Selects the last element that matches a specified CSS selector
Selects an element by its ID
quiz.answer: Selects all elements that match a specified CSS selector

quiz.question: How do you reverse the order of elements in an array?
quiz.answer: reverse()

quiz.question: What does the addEventListener method do in JavaScript?
options: Adds an event listener to a DOM element
Removes an event listener from a DOM element
Appends a new child element to a parent element
Adds a new event to the event queue
quiz.answer: Adds an event listener to a DOM element

quiz.question: What is the purpose of the setTimeout function in JavaScript?
options: Delays the execution of a function by a specified number of milliseconds
Repeats the execution of a function at a set interval
Halts the execution of a function
Sets the time zone of the script
quiz.answer: Delays the execution of a function by a specified number of milliseconds

quiz.question: What is the purpose of the Promise object in JavaScript?
options: To handle asynchronous operations and represent a value that might be available now, or in the future, or never
To create a new object
To check if a variable is defined
To concatenate strings
quiz.answer: To handle asynchronous operations and represent a value that might be available now, or in the future, or never

quiz.question: What is the purpose of the filter method in JavaScript?
options: Iterates over the elements of an array and applies a function to each element
Creates a new array with all elements that pass a test
Combines two arrays into one
Reduces the array to a single value
quiz.answer: Creates a new array with all elements that pass a test

quiz.question: What is the purpose of the slice method in JavaScript?
options: Returns a section of a string
Removes elements from an array and returns the removed elements
Adds elements to the end of an array
Reverses the elements of an array
quiz.answer: Creates a new array with all elements that pass a test

quiz.question: What is the purpose of the shift method in JavaScript?
options: Adds elements to the end of an array
Removes elements from the end of an array
Adds elements to the end of an array
Removes elements from the beginning of an array
quiz.answer: Removes elements from the beginning of an array

quiz.question: What is the purpose of the includes method in JavaScript?
options: Checks if a value is not a number
Checks if a value is a number
Checks if an array includes a certain element
Checks if a string includes a certain substring
quiz.answer: Checks if an array includes a certain element

quiz.question: What is hoisting in JavaScript??
options: Process of moving declarations to the bottom of their scope
Checks if a value is a number
Checks if an array includes a certain element
Process of moving declarations to the top of their scope
quiz.answer: Process of moving declarations to the top of their scope

quiz.question: What does NaN property in JavaScript?
quiz.answer: notanumber

quiz.question: What is memoization in JavaScript?
options: method to extract elements from an array or an object
it is a way to optimize application performance by caching results of time-consuming pure functions calculations
ability of a function to remember the variables and functions that are declared in its outer scope
Javascript mode to enforce stricter parsing and error handling on your javascript code
quiz.answer: it is a way to optimize application performance by caching results of time-consuming pure functions calculations

quiz.question: Which method is used to retrieve a character from a certain index?
quiz.answer: charAt()

quiz.question: What is Object Destructuring?
options: method to extract elements from an array or an object
it is a way to optimize application performance by caching results of time-consuming pure functions calculations
ability of a function to remember the variables and functions that are declared in its outer scope
Javascript mode to enforce stricter parsing and error handling on your javascript code
quiz.answer: method to extract elements from an array or an object

quiz.question: What is a  common pop-up box available in JavaScript??
options: alert
show_message
showToast
tkinter
quiz.answer: alert

it is a way to optimize application performance by caching results of time-consuming pure functions calculations
ability of a function to remember the variables and functions that are declared in its outer scope
Javascript mode to enforce stricter parsing and error handling on your javascript code

quiz.question: Which is not a state of a Promise in JavaScript?
options: pending
fulfilled
rejected
completed
quiz.answer: completed

quiz.question: Write is not a  type of error in JavaScript?
options: syntax error
logical error
runtime error
value error
quiz.answer: value error

quiz.question: What is Strict mode in JavaScript?
options: method to extract elements from an array or an object
it is a way to optimize application performance by caching results of time-consuming pure functions calculations
ability of a function to remember the variables and functions that are declared in its outer scope
Javascript mode to enforce stricter parsing and error handling on your javascript code
quiz.answer: Javascript mode to enforce stricter parsing and error handling on your javascript code

quiz.question: Which is the most used search Enginge in the world?
quiz.answer: google
